  - Owner = operator key (NOT the AI agent)   - AI agent never touches this contract directly   - Settlement is the only path from off-chain to on-chain   - PolicyGuard validates every settlement params.owner_: The operator address (holds the key, NOT the AI)
params.policyGuard_: The PolicyGuard contract for settlement validation

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

validateUserOp(bytes32,bytes).details: Called by the EntryPoint during the validation phase.      Returns 0 for success, 1 for signature failure.

execute(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Execute a single call from the wallet

executeBatch(address[],uint256[],bytes[].notice: Execute a batch of calls from the wallet

settleSession(bytes32,address,uint256,ui.notice: Settle a session's final balances on-chain.         This is THE critical function  the only path from         off-chain execution to on-chain finality. Flow:   1. PolicyGuard validates the settlement parameters   2. USDC is transferred to the wallet (or remains)   3. ETH amount is recorded   4. Session is marked as settled (replay protection)   5. Events are emitted for indexers
